title: Research Scientist
description:
Research Scientist

We look for research scientists with a proven record of research accomplishments in robotics, machine learning, computer vision, and other related fields. If you enjoy building systems and bring a solid foundation in engineering, you’ll thrive in this role. That said, we’re not just looking for the conventional path — we’re excited about people who can make an impact, no matter their background.

title: Controls Engineer
description:
Controls Engineer

As we advance our capabilities and scale our fleet of robotic systems, we’re hiring a Controls Engineer to own critical work at the intersection of controls, hardware, and robotic runtime. This role is highly hands-on and essential to ensuring that our systems are reliable, debuggable, and capable of supporting rapid research and deployment cycles.

An ideal candidate is a hands-on, systems-level thinker with deep expertise in controls and robot runtime, who thrives in quickly transforming environments and reliably delivers robust, field-ready robots.

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
Electrical Engineer

We’re looking for a hands-on engineering leader to drive the strategy, architecture, and execution of our electrical systems. In this role, you’ll own the end-to-end design and development of PCBAs — from early concept and architecture through schematic design, layout, bring-up, validation, and mass production. You’ll maintain precise validation and test processes, and ensure our systems meet the highest standards for reliability and compliance.

Beyond technical impact, you’ll set the direction for our electrical systems strategy, and foster a culture of collaboration, transparency, and first-principles problem solving.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Machine Learning Engineer

We are looking for engineers with expertise in machine learning systems, data pipelines, and large-scale training infrastructure. Successful candidates will have a proven record of accomplishment in building machine learning systems, working with large models in computer vision, language, or other areas, and an excellent understanding of machine learning infrastructure and systems fundamentals.

This is a very broad role that can be more focused on your specific area of expertise (e.g. data pipelines or large-scale training). You’ll be faced with challenges that other large-scale AI companies haven’t encountered. For example, unlike most foundation model companies, we don’t acquire our datasets through scraping the open internet, since the dataset we need to train our models largely doesn't exist. We generate petabytes of time-series data in-office and at offsite deployment locations, which then needs to be compressed, uploaded, processed, visualized and loaded onto gigantic training pipelines as efficiently as possible. If you’re up to the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
Mechanical Design Engineer

We're looking for an experienced mechanical design engineer to drive the integration and development of our robotic systems, leading innovative designs from concept to deployment. You'll own the full spectrum of mechanical development—from actuator sizing or design to kinematics and work with teams to prototype and ultimately produce systems at scale—ensuring reliability, deployability, and performance. The ideal candidate is a hands-on innovator with deep expertise in mechatronic systems, combining theoretical knowledge with practical engineering skills. Experience with actuation systems, electromechanical integration, machine design, and a track record of bringing mechanical systems to life is essential. If this sounds like you, please apply!

title: Research Engineer
description:
Research Engineer

We're looking for engineers who thrive in the ambiguity of research. In this role, you'll work shoulder to shoulder with researchers and engineers to build the most advanced AI systems to control robots in the real world. If you can implement complex research ideas in a clean, maintainable way, you'll succeed in this role. As a machine learning or robotics generalist with strong communication skills and a passion for solving the problem of physical intelligence, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact.

title: Robotics Systems Engineer
description:
Robotics Systems Engineer

We’re looking for software engineers that thrive on building the infrastructure that makes robotic systems reliable, observable, and scalable. You’ll design and maintain systems that maximize robot uptime, automate deployment, and accelerate data collection and evaluation pipelines. Strong skills in diagnostics, observability, and debugging complex distributed systems will be key, along with a mindset for creating resilient frameworks that adapt to diverse hardware platforms. The work you do here won’t just stay in the lab — it will shape how robots around the world learn and interact with their environments.

title: Runtime Generalist Engineer
description:
Runtime Generalist Engineer

Achieving real-world performance requires extremely tight system latency, reliable sensor pipelines, and end-to-end engineering that makes perception and control loops work at real-time speeds.

As a Runtime Software Engineer, you’ll engineer the low-latency, high-throughput systems that underpin our physical intelligence model. You won’t be designing ML models - you’ll be the person who makes them run flawlessly in production, optimizing every layer from OS to camera pipeline to networking. You’ll collaborate closely with researchers, platform engineers, and robotics operators to identify bottlenecks and extract maximum performance from the entire system.

description:
Head of Creative

We’re looking for a Head of Creative to shape how the world sees and experiences Physical Intelligence. We’ve been focused on the technical breakthroughs, but now, we need someone to tell our story, beyond the lab. You’ll help define the values, voice, and creative direction that guide everything we put into the world, and work hands-on to communicate that internally and externally. From our website to launching videos, from the way we explain our work to how we celebrate releases and show pride in our team, your influence will be felt across every touchpoint.

title: Business Operations
description:
Business Operations

Who We Are

Physical Intelligence is bringing general-purpose AI into the physical world. We are a group of engineers, scientists, roboticists, and company builders developing foundation models and learning algorithms to power the robots of today and the physically-actuated devices of the future.

As the company scales, success increasingly depends not just on research excellence, but on strong business execution - across partnerships, operations, infrastructure, and deployment.

Success in this role looks like independently identifying the highest-leverage problems, structuring them into executable plans, and driving them to measurable outcomes with minimal founder involvement.

The Team

This role sits close to the founders and works cross-functionally with research, engineering, operations, finance, legal, and external partners. There is no single “lane”, the mandate is to add leverage wherever the company most needs it.

In This Role You Will

- Own and execute cross-functional projects with high ambiguity and real business impact.

- Drive data, compute, and infrastructure partnerships, from sourcing through negotiation and management.

- Plug into deployment efforts: sourcing opportunities, structuring contracts, pricing, and operational setup.

- Assist with and drive internal scaling initiatives such as office expansion, international operations, and company planning.

- Support investor, board, and external communications including decks, analyses, and prep.

- Act as an execution arm for founders and leaders, translating priorities into outcomes.

What We Hope You’ll Bring

- Strong analytical and strategic instincts with a bias toward action.

- Comfort operating independently in ambiguous environments.

- Commercial mindset and basic financial fluency (contracts, pricing, tradeoffs).

- Exceptional written and verbal communication.

- Willingness to do anything, paired with strong prioritization instincts and comfort pushing back when work is low-leverage.

- Strong π-fit: respect for research and engineering culture, curiosity, and intellectual humility.

Bonus Points If You Have

- Background in consulting, venture capital, private equity, or finance.

- Experience negotiating vendor, data, or infrastructure agreements.

- Exposure to startups that have scaled quickly or inflected suddenly.

- International operations or cross-border project experience.

Operations

You’ll architect end-to-end processes, define success metrics, and build feedback loops that improve data accuracy and reliability, while leading a team of skilled operators in partnership with research and data collection to deliver vetted, trustworthy data at scale.

title: Robotics Service Technician
description:
Field Service & Maintenance Technician

As a Fleet Service & Maintenance (FSM) Technician at Physical Intelligence, you will play a critical role in maintaining our fleet of advanced robotic systems. You will be responsible for the electrical and mechanical upkeep of robotic platforms, ensuring they are running at peak performance and minimizing downtime. This role requires skills in both mechanical systems and electrical components, including troubleshooting, diagnostics, and hands-on repairs.

The ideal candidate will have a blend of hands-on mechanical and electrical system repair expertise, be highly detail-oriented, and the ability to work in a dynamic, high-tech environment.

title: Forward Deployed Robotics Engineer
description:
Forward Deployed Robotics Engineer

As a Forward Deployed Robotics Engineer, you'll serve as the first line of technical defense for our growing fleet of robotic systems deployed across warehouse and data-collection environments. Our diverse robot fleet—including both static and mobile systems—performs complex manipulation and sensing tasks in real-world settings. When issues arise, you'll be the first responder: analyzing field tickets, reproducing issues, gathering diagnostic data, and driving resolution to ensure maximum fleet uptime.

title: Hardware Systems Internship
description:
Hardware Systems Intern

We’re looking for a versatile Hardware Systems Engineering Intern to join our hardware team. This individual will support the development and improvement of critical infrastructure that supports our fleet’s health and uptime in a demanding hardware operation. What happens when you ask a robot to run a dishwasher for 8hrs a day? How hard is it really to make a cup of coffee? You’ll work alongside experienced mechanical and electrical engineers who are building the systems that enable robots to perform diverse tasks in warehouses as well as uncontrolled environments out in the wild.

title: Robot Operator
description:
Robot Operator

Data collection is key to our mission, and as a Robot Operator, you’re essential to making that happen. Your role involves delivering high-quality, high-volume demonstrations of tasks by teleo-perating our robots. You’ll either lead the robot’s movements, which it mirrors, or guide it using controllers we have designed. These tasks can range from something as simple as folding a batch of laundry to more complex activities like multi-step electronics assembly.

Our operators are meticulously detail-oriented, possess good dexterity, and enjoy taking on new challenges. If this sounds like you, we’d love to connect!
